intro: Pogostemon formosanus, commonly known as the Taiwan pogostemon, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or violet, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Pogostemon formosanus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
